ExampleDefinition.Title: Logarithmic Y-Axis
ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates a chart with three line-series and a Logarithmic Y-Axis
ExampleDefinition.Description: <Run FontSize="14" FontWeight="Bold">Logarithmic Y-Axis</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13">This example demonstrates X or Y logarithmic axes in SciChart. Click the controls to change state. None= linear axes, Y-Axis and X-Axis set the respective axes to logarithmic or linear.</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontWeight="Bold" FontStyle="Italic">Interactivity Options</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic"> - Drag to zoom.</Run> <LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic"> - Double click to zoom to extents.</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontWeight="Bold" FontStyle="Italic">Tip!</Run> <LineBreak/><LineBreak/> <Run FontSize="13" FontStyle="Italic">The axis labels may be formatted using Scientific notation with Superscript. See the NumericAxis.ScientificNotation property in the help file.</Run>
